newsitem.title: USA: Chevron readies Destin development plan.
newsitem.headline: Chevron readies Destin development plan.

text.p: Chevron U.S.A. Production Co, a unit of Chevron Corp, said on Monday it began the process of filing a development and production plan for the Destin Dome 56 unit.
The Destin Dome unit is made up of 11 federal lease blocks on the outer Continental Shelf about 25 miles south of Pensacola, Fla., in the eastern Gulf of Mexico.
The development is being proposed after the successful completion of an exploration plan, which confirmed dry natural gas in three wells in the unit.
The company said the proposed plan includes well sites, installation of production facilities and export of gas through pipelines.
The company said it would file documents by the end of the week to the Minerals Management Service, which will then consider the plan for approval.
Offshore activity is not expected until next year.
Chevron U.S.A. Production has a one-third interest in the Destin Dome unit. Other companies with an interest are Conoco Inc - a DuPont Co unit - and Murphy Exploration & Production Co.
